III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A continues to access marijuana and nicotine vape pens.
There are concerns that Youth A is not properly searched or drug
screened as needed when he leaves and arrives back to the
facility. Youth A may have also accessed a phone at the facility
and may be having contact with relatives that they should not
have contact with.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 05/16/2025.
Administrator reported Youth A went on a day pass with his
mentor on 05/02/2025. Youth A left the facility at 10:30 am and
returned at 5:00 pm. He said Youth A was searched and drug
screened and there were no contrabands found, and his drug
screen was negative. Administrator said on 05/14/2025 Youth A
had a visit with Foster Care Worker, who questioned him about
being found with a vape pen after his day pass, he admitted that
he had a vape pen. Youth A refused to say where he got the vape
pen. Administrator reported he is not aware of Youth A having
phone calls with his father. All phone calls are supervised by staff
and youths can only make calls to persons listed on their phone
logs. Youths' bedroom, bathrooms, common areas, and any other
areas that are used are searched daily. They have not found any
vapes during these searches.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 05/16/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for 9 months and is placed on pod 5. Youth
A reported he is approved to go on day passes and he had a day
pass with his mentor on 05/02/2025. He said he and his mentor
went out to eat and he came back to the facility. He was searched
when he returned to the facility. He denied having a vape pen
when he returned to the facility. Youth A admitted that he had a
vape pen on 05/14/2025. Youth A refused to say where he got the
vape pen and was adamant no staff member provided him with
the vape pen. Youth A denied he has had any contact with his
father. He said staff supervise phone calls and he is only allowed
to call persons on his phone log. Youth A reported feeling safe
and all his needs are being met. Youth A did not express any
concerns regarding the facility.
2

Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/16/2025. Youth B
has been at the facility one month and is placed on pod 5. Youth B
denied witnessing any youth or staff member using a vape pen on
the pod. Youth B reported that random room searches are
conducted and denied any vape pens being found. Youth B said
he heard that Youth A was found to have a vape pen, but he does
not know where Youth A got the vape pen. Youth B reported staff
supervise all phone calls and he can only call persons on his
phone log. Youth B expressed no concerns regarding staff
supervision.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 05/16/2025. Youth C
has been at the facility for 5 months and is placed on pod 2. Youth
C reported there are always staff supervising, he is participating in
individual and group therapy, and all his needs are being met.
Youth C denied witnessing any youths using vapes or having
access to vapes. Youth C reported staff supervise telephone calls
and he is only allowed to call persons on his log form. Youth C did
not express any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
05/19/2025. She reported Youth A has been at the facility for 9
months and has been struggling due to behavior. She had a visit
with Youth A on 05/14/2025 and Youth A admitted to having a
vape pen. Youth A refused to disclose where he got the vape pen.
Youth A was approved to have day passes; however, she has
suspended the passes. She said Youth A is only approved to have
telephone calls with his grandparents. Youth A ‘s brother had
reported that Youth A was communicating with his father via
telephone, however Youth A denied speaking with his father.
Foster Care Worker reported Youth A was drug screened after his
day pass on 05/14/2025 and his drug screens were negative.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 05/22/2025. JJ
Worker reported Youth D was placed at the facility from May 29,
2024, till May 14, 2025. Youth D was having home passes prior to
being discharged and there were never any concerns for Youth D
using or having access to a vape pen. She said Youth D was drug
screened after every home pass and his screens were always
negative. Youth D was drug screened on 05/19/2025 and he
tested positive for marijuana. Youth D was questioned about
testing positive for marijuana and he disclosed to her that he used
a vape pen when he was at placed at Calumet, prior to being
discharged from the facility. JJ Worker is not sure Youth D is
being truthful because he was not screened immediately after
being discharged from the facility. JJ Worker reported Youth D
3

completed the program successfully at Calumet and she did not
have any concerns while Youth D was placed at the facility.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 06/04/2025. She
reported she spoke with Youth A on 05/14/2025 and he refused to
say where he got the vape pen. Therapist reported Youth A was
drug screened after his day pass on 05/02/2025 and on
05/14/2025 and he tested negative for all drugs. Therapist said
she is not sure where Youth A got the vape pen. Therapist
reported Youth D was at the facility for one year and there were
never any concerns regarding vape pens.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 06/16/2025. Youth D
reported he was placed at Calumet Center for one year. He was
discharged from the facility on 05/14/2025. Youth D denied
reporting he used a vape pen while he was placed at the facility.
Youth D said he told his JJ Worker there were rumors that a youth
was found to have a vape pen. Youth D could not recall who the
youth was or who told him. Youth D reported he never had a vape
pen or saw any other youth on his pod have a vape pen. Youth D
expressed no concerns regarding the facility or the staff during his
placement at Calumet.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 06/25/2025. Staff 1
reported youths' bedroom are searched at the beginning of every
shift. Random searches are sometimes completed on the
visitation rooms, gym, and game room. She is not aware of any
vape pens found in those areas. Youth A refused to disclose were
he got the vape pen that was found on him. She is not aware of
Youth D having a vape pen while he was placed at the facility.
She said all phone calls are supervised, and youths are only
allowed to make calls to persons on their phone logs. She is not
aware of Youth A making calls to his father.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone 07/03/2025. Staff 2 has
been working at the facility for four months. She reported that
random room searches are completed daily and no vape pens
have been found in the rooms or the common area. She is familiar
with Youth A and he has never disclosed where he got the vape
pen. She is not aware of any other youth being found with a vape
pen. Staff 2 reported youths are only allowed to call persons on
their phone logs. She is not aware of Youth A call his father.
Documents Reviewed:
4

• DMC laboratories report for Youth A. Lab report dated
05/02/2025 negative screen. Lab report dated 05/14/2025
negative screen.
• Laboratories report for Youth D lab report dated 05/11/2025
negative screen.
• Notification of a Youth Reintegration visit for Youth A dated
05/02/2025- Youth A left at 10:30 am and returned to the
facility at 5:00pm. Youth A was found to have a vape pen.
• Facility resident search policy: Safety and Security
Coordinator must search residents at intake and when
returning from a community event.
• Facility Handbook details that contrabands are prohibited.
Any unauthorized items in a youth’s possession or in their
room will be considered contraband. Contraband includes
any item out of its designated area or any item that is
prohibited by program rules or treatment staff.
• Email from Director regarding searches: Random searches
are completed of the visitation rooms, gym, game room,
and cafeteria. There is no policy.
• Facility Phone Call policy: Youths are not allowed to make
outgoing phone calls unless authorized by the clinical case
manager. Youth are only allowed to call persons listed on
the approval phone call list.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule based on interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed, there is insufficient
evidence that youths are not being properly searched, and youths
have access to phones without proper supervision.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
